content: **issa mesh cardigan** // a v-neck crochet lace cardigan made sideways with ribbed finishing and button closure stuck between seasons reach for the stylish and versatile issa mesh cardigan with its relaxed fit and v-neck shape you can slip this on when you want to look put-together without sacrificing comfort if you ve been nervous about tackling your first crochet sweater this is the one i made it special to boost your crochet confidence without overwhelming you **materials** -970-1910 yards of color theory yarn see sizes below for the breakdown by size - substitute the worsted weight yarn of your choice -6mm and 5 5mm crochet hooks -scissors -tapestry needle -locking stitch markers -four to six 3/4-1 buttons -steam blocking supplies **sizes** all sizes are intended to have an oversized fit - 4-12 positive ease size down if you are in-between sizes photos show a model with a 34 bust in size xs/s xs/s intended for bust 28-34 970 yards m/l intended for bust 36-42 1175 yards xl/2xl intended for bust 44-50 1500 yards 3xl/4xl intended for bust 52-58 1765 yards 5xl intended for bust 60-62 1910 yards **techniques** -foundation stitches -crocheting in the round -double_crochet -crochet short row -applied ribbing technique -adding a button band -steam blocking find the free version of this project ** here 1 ** // buy more save more // use these codes to save when you buy multiple patterns saveon3 to save 10% off 3 patterns saveon5 to save 15% off 5 patterns saveon8 to save 20% off 8 patterns add all patterns to cart for discount limit one use per purchase 1 https //tlycblog com/issa-mesh-cardigan-a-free-crochet-lace-sweater-tutorial-pattern/
